name: <(ops::range::Bound<usize>, ops::range::Bound<usize>) as slice::index::SliceIndex<[T]>>::get_unchecked_mut

slice::index::into_range_unchecked.doc:
Converts a pair of `ops::Bound`s into `ops::Range` without performing any
 bounds checking or (in debug) overflow checking.

slice::index::SliceIndex::get_unchecked_.doc:
Returns a mutable pointer to the output at this location, without
 performing any bounds checking.

 Calling this method with an out-of-bounds index or a dangling `slice` pointer
 is *[undefined behavior]* even if the resulting pointer is not used.

 [undefined behavior]: https://doc.rust-lang.org/reference/behavior-considered-undefined.html
